alert.note: Alert for DeWitt; Gonzales; Karnes; Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 1:41PM CDT until May 13 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... DeWitt County in south central Texas... Central Gonzales County in south central Texas... Karnes County in south central Texas... Lavaca County in south central Texas... * Until 400 PM CDT. * At 141 PM CDT, Local law enforcement and TXDOT officials are reporting numerous flooded roadways across the region. Between 2 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cuero, Gonzales, Yoakum, Kenedy, Karnes City, Hallettsville, Yorktown, Shiner, Moulton, Runge, Smiley, Nordheim, Hochheim, Cheapside, Westhoff, Thomaston, Ezzell, Gillett, Sublime and Speaks. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
